definition: to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: This will make the liar at ease.
sentences.chinese: 这样就会让说谎者放松。

sentences.english: PICKTHAL:The lying, sinful forelock. SHAKIR:A lying, sinful forehead.
Even detectives and psychologists can spot a liar only about 47 percent of the time.
sentences.chinese: 就连侦探和心理学家也只能辨认出47%的说谎者。

sentences.english: Test suspected liars by making them read alternate versions of their stories.
sentences.chinese: 测试疑似说谎者时，可令他们以不同版本复述谎话。

sentences.english: A liar is not believed when he speaks thetruth.
sentences.chinese: 说谎者即使讲真话也没人相信。

sentences.english: Whether they will be cheats and liars is another matter.
sentences.chinese: 他们是否会是骗子和说谎者又是另一回事。

sentences.english: B liar is not believed when he speaks the truth.
sentences.chinese: 说谎者即使讲实话也没人相信。

sentences.english: "The best liars are natural manipulators," says Sgt.Yarbrough.
sentences.chinese: “最高明的说谎者是天生的操纵者，”亚伯勒中士说。

sentences.english: He labeled the boastful man a liar.
sentences.chinese: 他把那个好自夸的男人称作说谎者。

sentences.english: Satan, by his very nature, is a liar.
sentences.chinese: 撒旦是一个很自然的说谎者。

sentences.english: That's why a polygraph can often uncover a liar.
sentences.chinese: 这就是测谎仪能找出说谎者的原因。

sentences.english: Liars may noticeably fidget, especially during a pause in the conversation.
sentences.chinese: 说谎者会显得烦躁不安，尤其是在交谈的停顿时间里。

sentences.english: He couldn't deny that without being a bald-faced liar.
sentences.chinese: 他无法不需要身为脸白的说谎者就否认那。

sentences.english: Liars tend to use fewer first-person pronouns.
sentences.chinese: 说谎者很少用第一人称代词。

definition: to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
